question.body: Which is not a function of saliva?

multiple_choice.choice: lubricate tongue and lips for movement during speech
moistening to assist in formation of a bolus

response.feedback: Incorrect. The fluid does helps clean, as well as protect teeth because dry mouth can result in more cavities.
Incorrect. This is an important function, as seen if you get dry mouth because you are nervous about giving a speech in front of class.
Correct. The enzyme amylase in saliva only begins the digestion of carbohydrates; the lipase will only become active when it reaches the stomach pH.
Incorrect. This is an important function, as seen if you try to swallow something very dry like crackers without anything to drink.

part.hint: Saliva is a mixture of fluids, including mucus, water and enzymes.
